intro: Ardisia denigrata, commonly known as the dark ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are followed by bright red berries. Ardisia denigrata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fruit. It prefers acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full shade.
